Biology_505_r.News Finding: Unlocking the genomic sequence gives scientists unprecedented insights into the unique biology of the koala.
Biology_505_r.Paper Finding: At a continental scale, we show biogeographic barriers to gene flow associated with the Brisbane Valley and Clarence River, as identified by mtDNA studies , and find a barrier associated with the Hunter Valley, which was not previously known in koalas (Fig.
Biology_505_r.News Context: They have sequenced over 3.4 billion base pairs and more than 26,000 genes in the Koala genome - which makes it slightly larger than the human genome. Unlocking the genomic sequence gives scientists unprecedented insights into the unique biology of the koala. Professor Johnson said the uneven response of koala populations throughout their range was one of the major challenges facing broad scale management of the species.
Biology_505_r.Paper Context: We found evidence of low genetic diversity in southern koalas, consistent with a recent history of sequential translocations (Fig. At a continental scale, we show biogeographic barriers to gene flow associated with the Brisbane Valley and Clarence River, as identified by mtDNA studies , and find a barrier associated with the Hunter Valley, which was not previously known in koalas (Fig. Levels of inbreeding varied across regions (Fig.

Biology_448_r.News Finding: "While bacteria make this iron-scavenging compound for their own use, our research suggests that mammals--including humans--have learned over time to hijack it for their own benefit," said Han.
Biology_448_r.Paper Finding: Given the symbiotic relationship between commensal E. coli and the host, one may speculate that an unknown beneficial mechanism has evolved in animals to use bacterial Ent for host iron homeostasis.
Biology_448_r.News Context: The new study challenges that paradigm, suggesting that enterobactin also binds to a protein called ATP synthase inside the host's mitochondria, drawing iron into the host's cells too. "While bacteria make this iron-scavenging compound for their own use, our research suggests that mammals--including humans--have learned over time to hijack it for their own benefit," said Han. Oral antibiotics could potentially have the same impact, he says.
Biology_448_r.Paper Context: More importantly, this mechanism does not explain how host animals would cope with abundant Ent from non-infectious gut microbiota, of which enterobacteria are the most prevalent commensal microbes in both human and C. elegans . Given the symbiotic relationship between commensal E. coli and the host, one may speculate that an unknown beneficial mechanism has evolved in animals to use bacterial Ent for host iron homeostasis. In this study, by developing a unique and sensitive assay in C. elegans, we discovered an unexpected but logical role of bacterial Ent in supporting animal growth and iron level.
Biology_448_r.text: ['Finding: "While bacteria make this iron-scavenging compound for their own use, our research suggests that mammals--including humans--have learned over time to hijack it for their own benefit," said Han.']
Biology_448_r.displayed_text: Finding: "While bacteria make this iron-scavenging compound for their own use, our research suggests that mammals--including humans--have learned over time to hijack it for their own benefit," said Han.

Biology_tweet_11_r.News Finding:
An #OpenScience study on 1000 British teenagers aged between 14 and 15 and their carers finds no evidence that playing violent video games leads to aggressive behaviour  
cc. @username @username
Biology_tweet_11_r.Paper Finding: Results from these confirmatory analyses provided evidence that adolescents' recent violent video game play is not a statistically or practically significant correlate of their aggressive behaviour as judged by carers.
Biology_tweet_11_r.News Context:
An #OpenScience study on 1000 British teenagers aged between 14 and 15 and their carers finds no evidence that playing violent video games leads to aggressive behaviour  
cc. @username @username
Biology_tweet_11_r.Paper Context: Keeping in mind the steps taken to ensure methodological rigour, the current results bear directly on the contentious literature surrounding games. Results from these confirmatory analyses provided evidence that adolescents' recent violent video game play is not a statistically or practically significant correlate of their aggressive behaviour as judged by carers. Preregistered sensitivity and exploratory analyses demonstrated this finding was consistent across three different operationalizations of violent game content and two ways of measuring key adolescent behaviours relating to aggressive and prosocial behaviours.
Biology_tweet_11_r.text: ['Finding: An #OpenScience study on 1000 British teenagers aged between 14 and 15 and their carers finds no evidence that playing violent video games leads to aggressive behaviour \ncc. @username @username ']
Biology_tweet_11_r.displayed_text: Finding: An #OpenScience study on 1000 British teenagers aged between 14 and 15 and their carers finds no evidence that playing violent video games leads to aggressive behaviour cc. @username @username

Biology_tweet_124_r.News Finding:
Felids face continued threat from declining prey richness

#rewilding #megafauna #biodiversity
Biology_tweet_124_r.Paper Finding: A significant positive correlation was recorded between the number of prey species lost and the number of large-felid species lost from a cell.
Biology_tweet_124_r.News Context:
Felids face continued threat from declining prey richness

#rewilding #megafauna #biodiversity
Biology_tweet_124_r.Paper Context: In total, 86% of cells recorded at least one additional felid species in our present-natural counterfactual, and up to 4-5 more large-felid species in 10% of the cells. A significant positive correlation was recorded between the number of prey species lost and the number of large-felid species lost from a cell. Our results draw attention to the continuation of a trend of megafauna decline that began with the emergence of hominins in the Pleistocene.
Biology_tweet_124_r.text: ['Finding: Felids face continued threat from declining prey richness #rewilding #megafauna #biodiversity ']
Biology_tweet_124_r.displayed_text: Finding: Felids face continued threat from declining prey richness #rewilding #megafauna #biodiversity

Biology_124_r.News Finding:
advertisement

"The enhanced mortality and lung pathology were striking in clone-13 infected mice following ABHD12 inhibition or deletion," Teijaro says.
Biology_124_r.Paper Finding: We found that infection with a persistent dose of Cl13 caused a striking pathological response in ABHD -/mice, indicated by hunched posture, ruffled fur, labored breathing, and death in ~ 50% of the animals (Fig.
Biology_124_r.News Context:
Teijaro and colleagues found that the ABHD12-knockout mice, as well as the mice treated with the ABHD12 inhibitor, had immune responses that were much more vigorous and effective in clearing the virus, often excessively so. advertisement

"The enhanced mortality and lung pathology were striking in clone-13 infected mice following ABHD12 inhibition or deletion," Teijaro says. The findings suggest several possibilities to investigate with future research.
Biology_124_r.Paper Context: Relief of immune suppression by blocking negative regulatory molecules like PD-1 or IL-10 results in hastened control of Cl13 infection, as well as concomitant immune pathology that can produce severe morbidity and lethality . We found that infection with a persistent dose of Cl13 caused a striking pathological response in ABHD -/mice, indicated by hunched posture, ruffled fur, labored breathing, and death in ~ 50% of the animals (Fig. 6a) , correlating with gross lung damage ( Supplementary Fig.

Biology_174_r.News Finding: The researchers were able to successfully demonstrate through decreased adiposity and an improved metabolic profile the therapeutic potential of targeting NaKtide to the adipocytes.
Biology_174_r.Paper Finding: Our results showed that PGC1α levels, the master regulator of mitochondrial biogenesis and adaptive thermogenesis 36 , increased upon adipocyte-targeted NaKtide expression.
Biology_174_r.News Context: The basis of the research examined more closely the role of the adipocyte in obesity, including how it impacts oxidative stress, inflammation, neurodegeneration and NASH. The researchers were able to successfully demonstrate through decreased adiposity and an improved metabolic profile the therapeutic potential of targeting NaKtide to the adipocytes. "Our data clearly suggests that obesity and the Na/K-ATPase oxidant amplification loop plays a role in neurodegeneration," said first author Rebecca Pratt, a Ph.D. candidate in the department of biomedical research at Marshall University.
Biology_174_r.Paper Context: This highlights the importance of the Na/K-ATPase oxidant amplification loop within the adipocyte as well as the importance of adipocyte biology itself. Our results showed that PGC1α levels, the master regulator of mitochondrial biogenesis and adaptive thermogenesis 36 , increased upon adipocyte-targeted NaKtide expression. Furthermore, the expression of genes associated with mitochondrial biogenesis and "browning" of fat, including MFN1, MFN2, and SIRT1, were increased by NaKtide treatment.
Biology_174_r.text: ['Finding: The researchers were able to successfully demonstrate through decreased adiposity and an improved metabolic profile the therapeutic potential of targeting NaKtide to the adipocytes.']
Biology_174_r.displayed_text: Finding: The researchers were able to successfully demonstrate through decreased adiposity and an improved metabolic profile the therapeutic potential of targeting NaKtide to the adipocytes.
